reviews.review_msg: Extremely difficult to get a good grade. Instructions for the exams are unclear.

Laura really confused me in lecture, I took the class as a business student hoping to get something out of it but she was always off on a tangent she was hard to understand. The text gives you a deeper understanding of the works but really just understanding a few of the major concepts can get you through. Do well on the essays and you'll do fine.

Laura is great! While I understand the comments on clarity, I found her very easy to follow- she just has a unique style that really worked quite well for the material. A lot of it has to do with the type of mindset required to think about the works presented. She was also very helpful in office hours. The whole experience was fantastic.

I wasn't thrilled to have to take this mandatory SFU moneymaker however, I have really enjoyed the course and Ms. Marks has really grown on me. Although a little scattered she is very approachable and knowledgeable.  I get the feeling she really cares about students which I appreciate.

Marks seems to gear her lectures towards the dance students and the visual art students. She encourages discuss and often singles students out about their opinions. Her lectures are some what interesting however I wouldn't take this class if it wasn't a requirement. Average prof. Exams are changeling but doable,  assignment make up for low marks.

The content of this class is super interesting, it's just too bad that she taught it. Her lectures are all over the place and I honestly wouldn't have learned a thing if it wasn't for my TA, if anything you teach yourself. Totally weird but nice enough person. Also avoid buying the coursewear its a waste of money.
